trans-unit.source: Using the Twilio Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the Twilio Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the Twilio Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the Twilio Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Get started with the Twilio Connector and add it to your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Get started with the Twilio Connector and add it to your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Connect to your Twilio account to send and receive SMS messages.
trans-unit.target: Connect to your Twilio account to send and receive SMS messages.

trans-unit.source: You can also retrieve phone numbers and usage data.
trans-unit.target: You can also retrieve phone numbers and usage data.

trans-unit.source: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.
trans-unit.target: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.

trans-unit.source: You can add the Twilio Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the Twilio Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: Creating an Twilio connector for your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Creating an Twilio connector for your Logic App

trans-unit.source: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To create a connector from the Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: To create a connector from the Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure startboard, select Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure startboard, select Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: Search for “Twilio Connector”, select it, and select Create.
trans-unit.target: Search for “Twilio Connector”, select it, and select Create.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Twilio connector as follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure the Twilio connector as follows:

trans-unit.source: Location - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed
trans-unit.target: Location - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed

trans-unit.source: Subscription - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in
trans-unit.target: Subscription - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in

trans-unit.source: Resource group - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside
trans-unit.target: Resource group - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside

trans-unit.source: Web hosting plan - select or create a web hosting plan
trans-unit.target: Web hosting plan - select or create a web hosting plan

trans-unit.source: Pricing tier - choose a pricing tier for the connector
trans-unit.target: Pricing tier - choose a pricing tier for the connector

trans-unit.source: Name - give a name for your Twilio Connector
trans-unit.target: Name - give a name for your Twilio Connector

trans-unit.source: Package settings
trans-unit.target: Package settings

trans-unit.source: Account SID - The unique identifier of the account. Account SID for your account can be retrieved from
trans-unit.target: Account SID - The unique identifier of the account. Account SID for your account can be retrieved from

trans-unit.source: Auth Token - Authorization token associated with the account. Authorization Token for your account can be retrieved from
trans-unit.target: Auth Token - Authorization token associated with the account. Authorization Token for your account can be retrieved from

trans-unit.source: Click on Create.
trans-unit.target: Click on Create.

trans-unit.source: A new Twilio Connector is created.
trans-unit.target: A new Twilio Connector is created.

trans-unit.source: Once the API app instance is created, you can create a logic App to use the Twilio connector.
trans-unit.target: Once the API app instance is created, you can create a logic App to use the Twilio connector.

trans-unit.source: Using the Twilio Connector in your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Using the Twilio Connector in your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Once your API app is created, you can now use the Twilio connector as an action for your Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Once your API app is created, you can now use the Twilio connector as an action for your Logic App.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you need to:
trans-unit.target: To do this, you need to:

trans-unit.source: Create a new Logic App and choose the same resource group which has the Twilio Connector:
trans-unit.target: Create a new Logic App and choose the same resource group which has the Twilio Connector:

trans-unit.source: Open “Triggers and Actions” to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow:
trans-unit.target: Open “Triggers and Actions” to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow:

trans-unit.source: The Twilio connector would appear in the “API Apps in this resource group” section in the gallery on the right hand side:
trans-unit.target: The Twilio connector would appear in the “API Apps in this resource group” section in the gallery on the right hand side:

trans-unit.source: You can drop the Twilio Connector API app into the editor by clicking on the “Twilio Connector”.
trans-unit.target: You can drop the Twilio Connector API app into the editor by clicking on the “Twilio Connector”.

trans-unit.source: You can now use Twilio connector in the flow.
trans-unit.target: You can now use Twilio connector in the flow.

trans-unit.source: You can use the "Send Message" action in the flow to send a message.
trans-unit.target: You can use the "Send Message" action in the flow to send a message.

trans-unit.source: Configure the input properties for "Send Message" action as follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure the input properties for "Send Message" action as follows:

trans-unit.source: From Phone Number - Enter a Twilio phone number enabled for the type of message you wish to send.
trans-unit.target: From Phone Number - Enter a Twilio phone number enabled for the type of message you wish to send.

trans-unit.source: Only phone numbers or short codes purchased from Twilio will work with this connector.
trans-unit.target: Only phone numbers or short codes purchased from Twilio will work with this connector.

trans-unit.source: To Phone Number - The destination phone number.
trans-unit.target: To Phone Number - The destination phone number.

trans-unit.source: The format accepted is: +, followed by the country code, then the phone number.
trans-unit.target: The format accepted is: +, followed by the country code, then the phone number.

trans-unit.source: For example, +16175551212.
trans-unit.target: For example, +16175551212.

trans-unit.source: If you omit the +, Twilio will use the country code you entered in the 'From' number.
trans-unit.target: If you omit the +, Twilio will use the country code you entered in the 'From' number.

trans-unit.source: Text - The text of the message you want to send.
trans-unit.target: Text - The text of the message you want to send.

trans-unit.source: Do more with your Connector
trans-unit.target: Do more with your Connector

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at <link><linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at <link><linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title></link>.
